reviews.text: We went here from 9th june for 2 weeks. We took our 2 children 4 years and 20 months. This site is suitable for all. We stayed with eurocamp, who were excellent. The sunlight caravan we had was just a year old and in fantastic condition, it had everything we needed. The staff were very good and the manager seemed to have everything under control. The campsite is large but nothing is too far away. The on site facilities were great, very clean and well staffed. For many grocery items the on site shop is reasonable, in fact something were cheaper than the local supermarket (carrefour) in torroella, but shop around on days out and you can pick up a varied selection of food and drink. We hired a car (which for us was essential) from goldcar, watch out for the high fuel price charged at pick up, that said we could not have got the car cheaper anywhere else, just be prepared at your pick up point.
reviews.title: A great holiday, enjoyed by all.

reviews.text: We used the car to get out and about and can recommend : Pals, Girona, Figueres, Palamos and l'estartit. Nothing more that about 40-50 mins drive. We found that if you were happy to walk 5-10 mins into the towns then there is plenty of free parking available.
reviews.title: Wonderful Place

reviews.text: We had a couple of mornings/afternoons rain while we was there, but most days were around 27 degrees and even reached a rather warm 35 degrees. There is a breeze which cools the site, but towns inland can be hot.
reviews.title: 5th visit to El Delfin Verde

reviews.text: We suffered with mosquito bites a lot and would advise taking plenty of cream, plugs and fly spray (which costs a fortune in the local shops) etc with you, the site is surrounded by padi fields so they are inevitable really.
reviews.title: Perfect place for a family holiday!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all this was a fab holiday and would definately go back again.
reviews.title: Simply Great

reviews.text: We booked to stay here with Siblu (paid with Tesco Clubcard Vouchers) from 21st to 30th August in an Elegance caravan. We flew from Gatwick to Gerona with Ryanair, and hired a car with Europcar. We arrived about 8.30pm, but check in on arrival was quick and we found our caravan with ease. The day we arrived the weather was about 35C so the caravan was like an oven having been locked up all day!! You can hire Air Con units from Siblu for 65 euros, which is well worth it, but they are rather noisy! The caravan itself was really lovely, very spacious and well equipped. There were tables and chairs outside and a BBQ.
reviews.title: Great site, location, weather, facilities, everything!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The site is absolutely massive, but we never had trouble finding a spot around the dolphin shaped pool. You can hire sunbeds, but we didn't bother. There are grassy areas which we sunbathed on . The supermarket is also huge, and really reasonably priced. They stock quite a lot of English branded stuff also. There was a also a separate bakery hatch, whcih sold the most gorgeous cakes you can imagine! There were also numerous restaurants, ice cream and pancakes huts. We paid 5 euros for a meal deal in the snack bar by the pool, which was a huge plate of either burger, omelette, ½ chicken, chips and a drink.
reviews.title: I grew up with EDV!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: About a 5-10 minute walk away is a lovely sandy beach. The sea was very warm and excellent for children, as it actually got shallower the further you went out! You cannot hire sun loungers or umbrellas, so we took our Siblu umbrella which worked fine.
reviews.title: Beautiful campsite in beautiful area

reviews.text: The evening entertainment was OK, mostly put on by the staff with the odd magician and flamengo show thrown in. They have a mini disco and games for the kids, so mine were happy! Kids also went to Club Max which is run by Siblu which they enjoyed.
reviews.title: Too Quite

reviews.text: All in all, we had a fab time at El Delfin Verde and would definately return.
reviews.title: 1 week was just not enough!!!

reviews.text: There are 2 Eurocamp Safari Tents in the woodland area of El Delfin Verde. These 2 tents are side by side and perfect for 2 families travelling together (as we were). Firstly the tents - these are unique to Eurocamp and more about them can be found on Eurocamp's site. Excellent tents. Lots of living space, well equipped, comfortable beds. They even come with a heater for chilly May nights. The tents stood up to some pretty heavy rain and we all stayed warm and dry. Bring additional blankets if you're travelling early or late season. Duvets and sheets can be provided but you may find you need something extra. There is no cafetiere but there is a filter coffee pot which is a good 2nd best. Other than that the kitchen is well stocked with everything you need. Our kids loved the Eurocamp kids club and my daughter and her friend age 4 learned to ride a pedal bike (on 2 wheels - no stabilisers) in 3 lessons with Niek who was amazing with them. It was quiet and we were allowed to borrow the bikes for additional practice which was very useful. All the eurocamp staff we met here were very helpful. Eurocamp's directions are not brilliant - they take you into Torroella - would recommend calling them as you approach the area for detailed directions.
reviews.title: Eurocamp Safari Tent at El Delfin Verde

reviews.text: Now the site: I loved the woodland bit, not so keen on the bit down by the beach - bit too organised in neat rows and I would be disappointed if my view was the grey security wall over looked by the 1970's blocks to the right of the camp site. However that really is being overly critical - the woodland site is lovely. Just the right amount of "rough" tempered by the fact that it is spotlessly clean and well maintained. The supermarket has everything you need other than fresh fish (go to the fishmonger in Torroella de Montgri) and is not over priced. The beach is lovely, the pool is VERY cold in May but didn't stop our kids. We had some reasonable food in the restaurant, not the best ever spanish food but perfectly acceptable.
reviews.title: 6th year going back..

reviews.text: The boat trip to Illes Medes provided by the Nautilus company in Estartit was fab - well worth the money. Amazing Paella in Les Salides restaurant in Estartit. Playa d'Aro has some great ice-cream and Torroella is worth a stroll. Find the bon-bonnerie (near the fishmonger) and buy a plate of the mini-pattiseries for your afternoon tea at the tent).
reviews.title: El Delfin Verde won again...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We can't wait to find the time to return
reviews.title: Fantastic place for couples & Families

reviews.text: We have being going to El Delfin Verde for the last 5 years and love it more and more everytime we go back. We have stayed in the campsite, in the clipper houses and in the tres delfins(apartments) and I have to say the clipper houses are the best, so clean, well airconditioned, loads of space and beautiful own private seating area at the front. It is on the beach, and it has a large swimming pool also. The food on site it good also, the pizza take away and the crepes are AMAZING! You cant come here and not have a crepe.. :-) very good supermaket on site with beautiful bakery and great selection of food. We rent bikes every year and this is a great way to see the area. Staff are very helpful also, were all heading back there in June again this year and I can wait.. Oh also if you like markets, the neighbouring town of Torella De Montgri have a fantastic maket every Monday morning but get there early as it gets extremely busy.
reviews.title: Spent every holiday of my childhood here

reviews.text: this is a place i have visited many times over the years. my family and myself have fallen completely in love with it.
reviews.title: blooming fantastic

reviews.text: everything you need is there within the complex and within walking distance.
reviews.title: Everything under one roof...

reviews.text: the swimming pool is large and can get quite busy. although it is very clean and well kept.
reviews.title: caravan holiday in Aug 2011

reviews.text: the entertainment is awesome and the host speaks a number of languages, which makes it much easier too enjoy on site entertainment if you cannot understand spanish.
reviews.title: A warning

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: overall a fantastic place too holiday
reviews.title: Heaven! Back again next year!
